It seems to say that our works are quite important, and in fact, one can earn eternal live just by good works. But most certainly, there is nothing in either passage about a personal saviour.

 
 Good works are important, but they come AFTER you tell Christ that you believe in His death on the cross for your sins and you ask Him to govern your thoughts, soul, actions, etc. Good works and salvation go hand in hand. Neither one will work without the other. Good works are what show Christ's light to others through us. Understand?

that whoever believes in him shall not perish but have eternal life...

 Sorry. Still don't see any mention of a personal saviour.
 
 About Matthew 25, let me put it this way. The example given does not mention belief or faith or a personal saviour. It does not say that any of that is required. Since it is not mentioned, I assume that it is not required or your Bible is in error.
 
but they come AFTER you tell Christ that you believe in His death on the cross for your sins and you ask Him to govern your thoughts, soul, actions, etc.

 Since that's not what Matthew says I guess I was right. You just make it up to suit yourself as you go along.

Sorry. Still don't see any mention of a personal saviour.

 
 Wow, this is getting pretty sad. Let's see if I can explain this for you in terms that you can understand: whoever believes in Jesus death on the cross to save them of their sins can have life in heaven with Jesus. --< Does that make more sense to you? (Probably not but it was worth a try.)
 
 
About Matthew 25, let me put it this way. The example given does not mention belief or faith or a personal saviour. It does not say that any of that is required. Since it is not mentioned, I assume that it is not required or your Bible is in error.

 
 Is Matthew 25 the only chapter in the entire Bible that you choose to read? Oh, and did you forget to look up the word righteous? Here, I'll do it for you:
 
 righteous: especially, free from wrong, guilt, or sin;
 
 How does someone become righteous? 
 
 Acts 2:38 Peter replied, "Repent and be baptized, every one of you, in the name of Jesus Christ for the forgiveness of your sins. And you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.
 
 Those who have repented and asked for forgiveness are righteous. Now read part of Matthew 25:
 
 "Then the righteous will answer him, 'Lord, when did we see you hungry and feed you, or thirsty and give you something to drink? When did we see you a stranger and invite you in, or needing clothes and clothe you? When did we see you sick or in prison and go to visit you?' "The King will reply, 'I tell you the truth, whatever you did for one of the least of these brothers of mine, you did for me.' "
 
 The RIGHTEOUS will inherit the kingdom of heaven because they believed that Christ was who He said He was and they treated Him like royalty. The unrighteous did not believe therfore they did not treat Him well.
 
 "Then they will go away to eternal punishment, but the righteous to eternal life."
 
 
Since that's not what Matthew says I guess I was right. You just make it up to suit yourselfas you go along.

 
 Read the definition of righteous then read Matthew 25 again. Try studying the Bible before you make blatant claims about its "contradictions".

OK. I see that I was right. You get to make it up as you go. It really doesn't matter what the Bible says. What counts is what you want the Bible to say. Now if you could cite even one verse from the Bible that tells us about a personal saviour and somehow it might be different. But you can't. So I get to define what the words mean - not you. I don't have the blind faith in the Bible that you do and I don't even care. I just don't want your religion forced on me as a part of government - and since I know nothing, I get to define what you mean by the words.
 
 So let me get out my little golden book dictionary and have at it.
 
 Personal saviour - imaginary friend

OK. I see that I was right. You get to make it up as you go. It really doesn't matter what the Bible says. What counts is what you want the Bible to say.

 
 What have I made up?
 
 
OK. I see that I was right. You get to make it up as you go. It really doesn't matter what the Bible says. What counts is what you want the Bible to say.

 
 Do you not read any of my posts?
 
 John 6:29 Jesus answered, "The work of God is this: to believe in the one he has sent." 
 
 John 6:47 "I tell you the truth, he who believes has everlasting life."
 
 John 11:25 Jesus said to her, "I am the resurrection and the life. He who believes in me will live, even though he dies; 
 
 Acts 2:38 Peter replied, "Repent and be baptized, every one of you, in the name of Jesus Christ for the forgiveness of your sins. And you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit. 
 
 
So I get to define what the words mean - not you. I don't have the blind faith in the Bible that you do and I don't even care. I just don't want your religion forced on me as a part of government - and since I know nothing, I get to define what you mean by the words.

 
 I am not forcing anything on you. I don't have "blind faith" in the Bible. I actually study it. (Unlike some people who simply quote portions and whine and complain about how confusing it is.)
 
 
So let me get out my little golden book dictionary and have at it. Personal saviour - imaginary friend

 
 The funny thing is that I actually use a real dictionary. Not one in my head. You sound like you could use a friend and a savior. Like Jesus.
Why would any adult want an imaginary friend, much less one who is evil?

4 more Bible verses and none of them mention a personal saviour. And you ask me if I am reading what you post? I wonder if you are.
 
 I know. You blindly study the Bible without question.
 
 By the way, you still haven't answered my questions about the details of your detailed study of evolution in the other forum. You claimed that you had done a detailed study with an open mind, and yet you have been unable to name a single source that you studied. You didn't even name a creationist source (which would make "open mind" a lie).
 
 What's the deal? Weren't you being truthful?

4 more Bible verses and none of them mention a personal saviour. And you ask me if I am reading what you post? I wonder if you are.

 
 I just gave you 4 more verses which say that Christ died to save each and every one of us (personal) from hell and that all we have to do is acknowledge his death for us on the cross (savior).
 
 
I know. You blindly study the Bible without question.

 
 I don't "blindly" study the Bible without question. Why do you think I listen to what you have to say and then check it against what I know? I'd call that "questioning" my faith.
 
 
 By the way, you still haven't answered my questions about the details of your detailed study of evolution in the other forum. You claimed that you had done a detailed study with an open mind, and yet you have been unable to name a single source that you studied. You didn't even name a creationist source (which would make "open mind" a lie). What's the deal? Weren't you being truthful?

 
 If I named my sources you would have a temper tantrum at the first creationist source that I named. I also fail to see why you define "detailed study" as a college course.
 
 Have you taken any courses on the Bible? Have you ever even read the Bible? (Other than Matthew 25. :))
Lurch you are looking for direct words. In Matthew 25 I donot where it says anything about if you live a rightous life you don't have to get saved.
So do you see what im talkin about? Exect words are not going to be found.

Ha, this is funny. idiot is doing the exact same thing he accused me of, except he's not doing it in a direct way. Amusing hypocritical fool. 
 
 Continue.

Well Calli,
 
If I named my sources you would have a temper tantrum at the first creationist source that I named.

 No. I would just know that you don't have an open mind on the issue. I have already shown on several occasions that your sources are wrong. You seem to agree since you routinely fail to answer.
 
I also fail to see why you define "detailed study" as a college course.

 Because I seriously doubt that you can do a detailed study of the topic without any study at post secondary level. It is possible, but I doubt, from the knowledge that you have displayed of the topic, that you have accomplished it. I seem to be correct in that you have abandoned those threads, apparently because I have asked for knowledge that you don't have. If your study had been "detailed", then you would have had answers for those elementry questions. Additionally, it is impossible to do a detailed study of evolutionary theory from creationist sources - the texts don't exist.
 
Have you taken any courses on the Bible?

 Yes. In college, as a matter of fact. My teacher was a remarkable man with a PhD who could place the events of the Bible in relation to history and each other. He was also able to discuss the meaning from the original Hebrew and Greek.
 
Have you ever even read the Bible? (Other than Matthew 25)

 Yes. All of it - cover to cover, most of it several times and much of it in three languages.
 
 How about you? Have you read Futuyma's Evolutionary Biology? Or perhaps, Mayr's What Evolution Is?. Probably not Dawkins' River Out of Eden. Maybe The Theory of Evolution by John Maynard Smith.
 
 And I seriously doubt that your detailed study included such a detailed (1464 pages) treatment of the subject as Gould's The Structure of Evolutionary Theory. Actually, I'm still working on the last.
 
 I have also read some books by Henry Morris and I often read the Impact articles from the ICR site. I read transcripts of debates from Gish and others. I read most of the stuff posted at AIG by Sarfati, Ham, Weiland and others, and I have read Walt Brown's book, In the Beginning. I have listened to Kent Hovind's seminars (all 16 hours - it took a week) and I have visited the Creation Evidences Museum in Glen Rose, Texas and listened to a lecture by Carl Baugh. All of them are wrong about what they tell you about evolutionary theory - some of them are liars.
 
 So what books/papers/journals have you read that are part of your detailed, open minded study? If your detailed study of evolutionary included anything by any of the above, you have not studied evolutionary theory. It seems to me that an open mind would require reading what evolutionary theorists actually say.
 
 So are you going to come back to the other forum and discuss it or are you going to show that I am correct - that you have a closed mind - and stay away?
Have you read "The Third Chimpanzee" by Jared Diamond. I can;t force my way though those others but this one I actually enjoyed. It's a good starter.

No. I haven't but probably should. It is rated very highly at amazon.com, mostly 4 and 5 * with a few 3s. Considering that it won a Pulitzer Prize it should be pretty good. I've had it on my list of books for years but just haven't gotten around to reading it.

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  Jesus was a Liberal
